thread.title: There Were Two Must-See Knockouts To Watch From UFC London
thread.title_full: There Were Two Must-See Knockouts To Watch From UFC London

author: bnealon
title: There Were Two Must-See Knockouts To Watch From UFC London
text:
Comments 
UFC Fight Night 2017 went down this past Saturday in London, and it did not disappoint, giving us a fair share of dome-rattling knockouts. 
The best was Marc ‘The Bonecrusher’ Diakiese’s right hand knockout of Teemu Packalen. Diakiese, who improved his record to 12-0, threw two stunning spinning teakwood kicks within the first five seconds of the fight, forcing Packalen to strike immediately at close range. This proved to be a fatal mistake, as Diakiese dropped Packalen with the next punch, sending him to the floor sleeping. 
SEE ALSO: This is 2017's Knockout Of The Year 
The fight lasted all but 30 seconds, but I'm sure for Packalen it felt much longer. OHHHH M !!!! @Marc_Diakiese STIFLES Packalen w/ a right hand in the FIRST ROUND! What. A. KO!!! #UFCLondon pic.twitter.com/c9wPu0j1uW 
And if that KO wasn't enough, check out Jimi Manuwa’s walk-off knockout of Corey Anderson! And that's that!!!! Jimi Manuwa finishes Corey Anderson via KO in RD1 at #UFCLondon @POSTERBOYJM pic.twitter.com/mLZb7rIpvC 
— MMAHEYDAY (@MMAHEYDAY) March 18, 2017 
Although, these were the best knockouts of the night, there was one other great moment. 
After nearly 15 years in the cage, bantamweight and featherweight Brad Pickett, hung up his gloves. In what would be Pickett’s last fight, he was knocked out by his opponent, Marlon Vera. O THAT'S IT! @ChitoVeraUFC spoils Pickett's finale and gets the head kick KO! #UFCLondon on @UFCFightPass NOW! pic.twitter.com/f8XcslXu9Q
